title: Minimum value of a function given its derivative

content.question: The derivative of the function f is given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi> </mrow> </msup> <mi>cos</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@446A@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, for all real numbers x. What is the minimum value of f(x) for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>1</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CDE@</annotation> </semantics> </math>?

choices.label: There is no minimum value of f(x) for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>1</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CDE@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

topic.text: 5.5: Using the Candidates Test to Determine Absolute (Global) Extrema

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
